id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID with which you will be able to reference the QR-code later in your display code.

*See also: [QR Code Component](https://esphome.io/components/qr_code.html#configuration-variables)*

value.docs:
**string**: The string which you want to encode in the QR-code.

*See also: [QR Code Component](https://esphome.io/components/qr_code.html#configuration-variables)*

LOW.docs: The QR Code can tolerate about 7% erroneous codewords

MEDIUM.docs: The QR Code can tolerate about 15% erroneous codewords

QUARTILE.docs: The QR Code can tolerate about 25% erroneous codewords

HIGH.docs: The QR Code can tolerate about 30% erroneous codewords

ecc.docs:
**string**: The error correction code level you want to use. Defaults to `LOW`. You can use one of the following values:
  * `LOW`: The QR Code can tolerate about 7% erroneous codewords
  
  * `MEDIUM`: The QR Code can tolerate about 15% erroneous codewords
  
  * `QUARTILE`: The QR Code can tolerate about 25% erroneous codewords
  
  * `HIGH`: The QR Code can tolerate about 30% erroneous codewords
  
  

*See also: [QR Code Component](https://esphome.io/components/qr_code.html#configuration-variables)*
